title: Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn clash over NHS funding – video
text:
In a heated exchange during PMQs on Wednesday, Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn clashed over NHS funding. The Labour leader said: ‘I hate it to break it to the prime minister, but under his government and that of his predecessor, privatisation has more than doubled to £10bn in our NHS. There are currently 20 NHS contracts out to tender.’

Johnson responded by saying Corbyn was ‘completely wrong’ in his assessment of NHS privatisation, adding that the 47,000 extra clinical staff he had promised were paid for from public funds and that was possible because the Tories believed in ‘sound management of the economy’
description: In a heated exchange during PMQs on Wednesday, Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn clashed over NHS funding
